If you run the compiled bitrev.cpp as:

./bitrev 16

you should get output something like:

   0 0000    0 0000
   1 0001    8 1000
   2 0010    4 0100
   3 0011   12 1100
   4 0100    2 0010
   5 0101   10 1010
   6 0110    6 0110
   7 0111   14 1110
   8 1000    1 0001
   9 1001    9 1001
  10 1010    5 0101
  11 1011   13 1101
  12 1100    3 0011
  13 1101   11 1011
  14 1110    7 0111
  15 1111   15 1111

It's also OK if the output is comma-delimited in each row
instead of evenly lined up in columns.


another example:

./bitrev 32

   1 00001   16 10000
   2 00010    8 01000

   5 00101   20 10100
   6 00110   12 01100

  10 01010   10 01010
  11 01011   26 11010

  13 01101   22 10110
  14 01110   14 01110
  15 01111   30 11110
  16 10000    1 00001
  17 10001   17 10001
  18 10010    9 01001
